chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
The defendant Manuel Lloyd Pate was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing An Officer Causing A Soft Tissue Injury To Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(2r).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample.  The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharge by November 1, 2024.  Court waived all other court costs, fees and surcharges due to a finding of indigency.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.  Credit for 5 months.  A time served disposition.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may never own or possess a firearms.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

charges.descr: Obstructing An Officer Causing A Soft Tissue Injury To Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Manuel Lloyd Pate

records.addlTxt:
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.

Defendant Manuel Lloyd Pate in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Defendant Manuel Lloyd Pate in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for a plea and sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded.

...
Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to any other sentence, with credit for 5 MONTHS.  A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  

The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample.  The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharge by November 1, 2024.  Court waived all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. 

20 day appeal rights given.

HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.

Defendant Manuel Lloyd Pate in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Defendant Manuel Lloyd Pate in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for an arraignment/plea and sentencing.  Court holds colloquy with defendant regarding his right to appear in person before the Court.  Court finds defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives his right to appear in person before the Court and agrees to proceed electronically via Zoom.  State informed the Court that they have not met victim notification law.  Court finds notice has been met and proceeds to plea/sentencing hearing.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court, defendant Manuel Lloyd Pate not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for an arraignment.  Defendant was not produced from Fox Lake CI.  Court rescheduled the matter for an arraignment/plea and sentencing.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Arraignment scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

This case will be heard via Zoom.  Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum
Received and Filed: Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Received and Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Manuel Lloyd Pate in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Defendant Manuel Lloyd Pate in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense requests an arraingment date. Next date provided by the clerk in Br. 40.  Arraignment scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Andrew Golden.

Defendant Manuel Lloyd Pate in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Manuel Lloyd Pate in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Manuel Lloyd Pate in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Manuel Lloyd Pate appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court ordered no contact with T.L Mason, unless necessary in Off. Mason's official capacities as a law enforcement officer
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
